speaker: Guest
content: I mean, as I said, I think there's that account abstraction EIP that was I I I can't remember if it was included in Capella or pushed out to the next upgrade because there was a bit of discussion around this. Uh and a few other things that um, as I said, aren't directly user-facing. I believe there's one that allows you to exit a validator from the execution layer, which essentially means that you can send a normal Ethereum transaction on the normal kind of um, where you do normal transactions, uh and essentially do uh exit a validator. So with uh withdraw the stake but also shut down that validator. Right now you can only do it from the consensus layer side, which means that the staking protocols that exist today aren't fully trustless because you have to basically go to them and say, 'Hey, I want to exit this validator,' and they have to go to the the validator operator and say exit it. In the future with this upgrade that's coming, uh you won't have to do that. You can just send the exit message on the normal user-facing side, yeah, and you have a fully trustless staking protocol, which is cool.
